metadata.title: CVE-2023-26768 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer Overflow vulnerability found in Liblouis v.3.24.0 allows a remoteattacker to cause a denial of service via the compileTranslationTable.c andlou_setDataPath functions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-26768` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblouis-bin - 3.12.0-3ubuntu0.2
liblouis-data - 3.12.0-3ubuntu0.2
liblouis20 - 3.12.0-3ubuntu0.2
python3-louis - 3.12.0-3ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: liblouis package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.12.0-3ubuntu0.2').
